captions.text:
Vsauce, I'm Jake and if there is a finite
amount of matter in the universe, then how

does Olive Garden offer unlimited breadsticks?
And shouldn't the back of knees be called

legpits? Very true Kevin but these...are thoughts
.com. Now lets write messages in some hairy

backs and check out more DONGs...Things you
can do online now, guys.

Build With Chrome is an incredibly cool site
where you make whatever you can imagine out

of Lego. There's the Build Academy so you
can master your abiuldity or explore the amazing

creations people all over the world have made.
I'm going to build a house for myself on a

nice street, a sesame street...fighter the
ultimate spelling fighting game. Pick from

characters like Cookie Monster, Grover, Bert
or Elmo but remember that each one has a different

topic. Like Russian Cities... Once in battle
spell faster than your opponent to take them
down to sesame defeat.

Even though you've won a few rounds keep training
by testing your vocabulary. Choose yes or

no from a variety of real and fake words to
find out how many you actually know versus
how many are made up.

And since it's been 5 minutes since you last
heard the name Flappy Bird, play this version

of the game where instead of pressing to move
up you spell your way through the tubes and
it...is...horrible...

All this talk of typing and vocab makes me
wish there was a great language game .com

where you distinguish between 80 different
languages, from sound alone. You are allowed

three lives each time you play, and the ones
you miss are kept for you to study at the
end

But you've mastered it because you got that
Midas Touch. Midas is a great puzzle platformer.

In the game everything you touch turns to
gold. Blocks you hit fall under their new

weight and that can either benefit you, or
make your life incredibly difficult. Just

be sure you touch some water before you reach
your love or she will become gold as well.

Oh man, this game brings out all the emotions.....
of sound. Different sounds are played and

with each one there are number of emotions
to choose. Does a thunderstorm make you feel

relaxed, anxious, romantic, annoyed, sad?
Once you decide, it will show what others
have chosen.

Let's go out in the thunderstorm and play
in the rain. Get it to be exactly how you

like it and put in objects to see how they
interact with the water drops.

This is kind of relaxing so lets sit here
and wait...wait for it....come on.. come on....I'm

not gonna spoil it for ya so let's ChangeType().
A game where your character has the ability

to swap items with others. So if you need
to cross some spikes, just grab a block and

change them into the spikes. You can swap
anything which makes it so the levels can

be completed in many different ways just by
experimenting.

And for more experiments Andrew Hoyer created
a bunch online to play with like these Zoetrope,
a fun particle System ,or a blob...

Which looks similar to the face combination
you can make with screen toys. Start by picking

some mugs... ok...Nic Cage, obviously and
why not Dumbledore. Then adjust the parameters
and drag em around.

That's actually kind of terrifying. I'm just
going to send myself an email in the future

as a reminder to never do that again. Now
that that's sent, lets send ourselves to the

moon....moon...moon....moon... dot com. An
interactive site where you you draw on a virtual

moon. Pick a spot, create your work and let
the world see it with their own eyes, unless

they cant see in which case try the Eyesight
Simulator. Put in your own or a random prescription

and check out what it looks like. Sweet momma,
I'm blind. Maybe I can correct this by playing

with my giant eye. You can pretty much change
and adjust whatever you want and it is actually

really cool as the pupil will dilate or contract
depending on where the light source is.

And what's that? Is that a twinkle in your
eye? It must be for your twitter love... Type

in your username and see who that special
someone is... oh hey there Kevin...Alright

well let's just check who Kevin love- you
son of a

Jake, calm down and chill...ing vibes, a free
website that pairs relaxing music with awesome

photos. You can submit your own music and
pictures for consideration, or just sit back
and chill.

If you do want to send in your own jams, make
them with a Theremin, a responsive audio synthesizer

that let's you control the waveform, delay,
and feedback to drop the beats...yo...so relaxing

And keep that music creation going with D3.
A site by Adam Pearce where you add notes

to a circular synth to make something like
this...

Links to everything can be found in the description
below.

With these DONGs there is a new Just Awesome
Music LEANBACK for you over on WEsauce. So

listen to these JAMs while you do your DONGs
and, as always, thanks for watching.
